@graph.name: Vegan Gingerbread Biscotti - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Vegan Gingerbread Biscotti with cranberries, almonds, candied ginger. Easy Crispy Spiced Biscotti Recipe to dunk in a cup of tea. Drizzle with white or dark chocolate. Vegan Recipe.

@graph.name: Vegan Gingerbread Biscotti with cranberries, almonds, candied ginger
@graph.description: Vegan Gingerbread Biscotti with cranberries, almonds, candied ginger. Easy Crispy Spiced Biscotti Recipe to dunk in a cup of tea. Drizzle with white or dark chocolate. Vegan Recipe. To double, use 1 1/2 tsp baking powder and 1/4 tsp baking soda, double everything else. Use more flour if needed to make a soft dough.
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp chia seed meal  (or 1 tbsp flax seed meal)
1/4 cup sugar (1 tbsp more for sweeter)
1 tsp oil (or use more almond butter)
1.5 to 2 tsp gingerbread spice (or use 1 tsp ginger, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, a generous dash of ground nutmeg, clove and black pepper)
1 to 2 tbsp finely chopped candied ginger
1 to 2 tbsp almond slivers  (or chopped pistachios)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180ºc.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F / 180ºc.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl mix the molasses, milk and chia seed meal. Mix and let sit for 2 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix until well combined. The nut butter will take a minute to mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl mix the molasses, milk and chia seed meal. Mix and let sit for 2 minutes. Add the rest of the ingredients and mix until well combined. The nut butter will take a minute to mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add dry to the wet and mix. Add in the cranberries, almonds, ginger. Mix and make a soft dough. If the dough is too sticky, add 1 tsp or more flour. If too dry, sprinkle a few drops of water at a time to knead in.
recipeInstructions.name: Add dry to the wet and mix. Add in the cranberries, almonds, ginger. Mix and make a soft dough. If the dough is too sticky, add 1 tsp or more flour. If too dry, sprinkle a few drops of water at a time to knead in.

recipeInstructions.text: Shape into a log and press down to make a flat rectangle about 9 by 4 inches.
recipeInstructions.name: Shape into a log and press down to make a flat rectangle about 9 by 4 inches.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 24 to 26 minutes. The edges should be crisp and the center set but should have just a bit of give. Do not let it overbrown. Bake a few minutes longer if baking double recipe (2 logs).
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 24 to 26 minutes. The edges should be crisp and the center set but should have just a bit of give. Do not let it overbrown. Bake a few minutes longer if baking double recipe (2 logs).

recipeInstructions.text: Cool for 15 to 20 minutes. Slice using a serrated knife. Place the biscotti on the side and bake at 300 degrees F / 150ºc until crisp. 15 to 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool for 15 to 20 minutes. Slice using a serrated knife. Place the biscotti on the side and bake at 300 degrees F / 150ºc until crisp. 15 to 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool completely. Dress with melted vegan chocolate or icing of choice. Store in a container on the counter for a bunch of weeks.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool completely. Dress with melted vegan chocolate or icing of choice. Store in a container on the counter for a bunch of weeks.
